oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Exterior of the Saigon Zoo
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The exterior of a building in Saigon that Christopher Ammons has identified as the Saigon Zoo. It has a highly stylized roof and writing down either side of the entrance. Several trees are visible on the property, and a number of individuals can be seen in the street in front of the building.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Zoos; Buildings
Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam; Saigon (Vietnam)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: When Ammons took this photograph, he was on leave in Saigon, where he met up with fellow soldier Karl Knudson. They enjoyed many of the sights in Saigon, including the zoo, the Presidential Palace, and the U.S. Embassy.
